TEXT: CARDINAL . The present case was referred to the ORG in DATE by both ORG ( " the Commission " ) and ORG of GPE and GPE ( " the Government " ) . The case originated in CARDINAL applications ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) against GPE lodged with the Commission in DATE by Mrs. PERSON and by Mrs. PERSON on behalf of herself and her son PERSON , the latter also being hereinafter referred to as an " applicant " .

CARDINAL . By judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG held that the existence of corporal punishment as a disciplinary measure in the schools attended by the applicants’ sons did not constitute , as regards those children , a violation of LAW ) of the Convention but did constitute , as regards their parents , a breach of the second sentence of LAW No . CARDINAL ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) . It also held that , as regards PERSON , his suspension from school following his refusal to accept such punishment had given rise to a breach of the first sentence of the last - mentioned LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) ( Series A no . DATE , points CARDINAL of the operative provisions and paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the reasons , pp . CARDINAL ) .

The only outstanding matter to be settled is the question of the application of LAW ) in the present case . Accordingly , as regards the facts , the ORG will confine itself here to giving the pertinent details ; for further particulars , reference should be made to paragraphs CARDINAL of the above - mentioned judgment ( ibid . , pp . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . At the hearings on DATE , counsel for Mrs. PERSON had stated that , should the ORG find a violation , his client would seek just satisfaction under LAW ) in respect of moral damage and legal costs . The Government had not taken a stand on the matter , nor had counsel for Mrs. PERSON .

In its judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG reserved the whole of this question . ORG was invited to submit to the ORG , within DATE , written observations thereon and , in particular , to notify ORG of any friendly settlement at which the ORG and the applicants might have arrived ( point CARDINAL of the operative provisions and paragraph CARDINAL of the reasons , ibid . , pp . CARDINAL and DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Mr. PERSON and Mr. PERSON , substitute judges , took the place of Mr. PERSON and Mr. PERSON , who were prevented from taking part in the further consideration of the case ( Rules CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of ORG ) .
CARDINAL . Having consulted , through the Registrar , the Agent of the Government and the Delegates of the Commission , the ORG decided on DATE that there was no call to hold hearings .
